image.altText: An artist's impresiion of a high-rise residential development.

props.synopsis: Two companies that made false claims about approvals for light rail stops near a luxury apartment building in Woden are fined more than $3 million each under consumer laws.

title.children: 'Scornful of consumers': Canberra companies fined millions over false advertising

image.altText: A person places a vote in a Senate ballot box for Canberra.

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: All the ACT seats, candidates and voting facts you need to know

image.altText: A woman with short, light hair, smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council is auctioning two dozen properties to recover unpaid rates. But local Gina Greentree says the council has bungled the process, with the farmer bidding for a lot she thought she owned.

title.children: Property of man dead for 65 years among lots auctioned for unpaid rates

image.altText: A man in a jacket looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Liberal candidate Jacob Vadakkedathu called the Coalition's plans to cut jobs in the public service "not realistic" and "not practical".

title.children: Liberal candidate breaks ranks with Peter Dutton over public service

image.altText: A woman in a navy sweater sorts eggs

props.synopsis: Communities in the region surrounding Canberra are urging candidates not to forget their specific needs as the federal election approaches.

title.children: Minutes from Canberra, these towns still need more of the basics

image.altText: Kendrick Lamar smiles and points as he performs in a blue and black leather jacket, blue jeans, gloves and a black backwards cap

props.synopsis: No crying over this one, mates.

title.children: Kendrick, Doechii, Dominic Fike and more tapped for Spilt Milk's big return

image.altText: A woman in glasses holds her baby who wears a grey wiggles jumpsuit.

props.synopsis: This mother-of-two is among a growing number of people seeking out food relief for the first time, which includes families and people with stable jobs and mortgages.

title.children: Skylee turned to free food pantries to feed her family and she's far from alone

image.altText: Nurse in home

props.synopsis: Union representatives say it took four nurses getting assaulted and a prohibition order before Canberra Health Services listened to their calls for safety. Now they say safety is worse than before.

title.children: 'It could result in death': Nurses assaulted during in-home visits

image.altText: Adam Bandt holds up a giant toothbrush and a mock medicare card

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has his Medicare card and Adam Bandt has the giant toothbrush again, while Peter Dutton taste tests orange juice as the leaders make their final pitches to voters. Follow live.

title.children: Props front and centre as leaders make final pitches on campaign trail

image.altText: A graphic shows a smartphone screen showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Housing, cost of living, health and Australia's energy future have been front and centre this election campaign. Here's what the Vote Compass data tells us about where respondents stand on key issues.

title.children: Vote Compass data reveals key issues for Australian voters

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's murder trial hears she complained doctors were being "mean" to her as they sought to move her and her children into expert care, fearing they'd been exposed to deadly mushroom toxins.

title.children: Erin Patterson 'hates hospitals', estranged husband tells her murder trial

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob sits in a black dress with a white collar holding a guitar, smiling.

props.synopsis: While best known for 90s hits 'Supermodel' and 'I Kissed A Girl', Jill Sobule's career spanned three decades, 12 albums and more.

title.children: Jill Sobule, singer behind I Kissed A Girl and Supermodel, dead at 66

image.altText: a blue corflute that's been burnt and attached to a pole

props.synopsis: Candidates have seen their election signs marked with swastikas or offensive slurs, burned, vandalised, smeared with excrement, stomped on and shredded.

title.children: Hundreds of election signs destroyed or removed

image.altText: voters

props.synopsis: As the countdown to May 3 draws nearer, a growing group of gen Z and millennial voters are threatening to destabilise key seats. Here's why.

title.children: The 'unpredictable' group of voters that could influence these key seats

image.altText: A jar of pencils.

props.synopsis: Think you know the numbers behind the federal election? Try our quiz!

title.children: Test your knowledge with our federal election numbers quiz

image.altText: two male politicians wearing suits at a park

props.synopsis: The Coalition enters the dying hours of the 2025 election campaign defending its budget against charges from some of the nation's top economists that it erodes the Coalition's self-declared legacy of fiscal responsibility.

title.children: Voter 'bribes' send Taylor 'off brand' with bigger deficits, say budget experts

image.altText: A crashed helicopter in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Three people suffered serious injuries when their helicopter crashed in water between Point Lonsdale and Ocean Grove on Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula.

title.children: Three people survive helicopter crash near Geelong

image.altText: People walk through the Chadstone Shopping Centre

props.synopsis: Labor and the Coalition are promising to spend big to help households deal with the cost of living. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: What the major parties' cost-of-living pledges mean for you

image.altText: Woman with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The sentencing judge heard Ms Anderson lived in fear of her ex-boyfriend Tyrone Thompson and desperately sought help before he got out of jail, hunted her down and stabbed her 78 times.

title.children: Ex who stabbed Mackenzie Anderson to death jailed for 22 years

image.altText: The two men standing shoulder to shoulder, Pope Francis does not look amused

props.synopsis: The conclave will be a "fight for the soul of the Catholic Church" between those who saw promise in the modernising changes Pope Francis made and those "who hated him for it".

title.children: MAGA's 'vicious fight' for the 'soul of the Catholic church'

image.altText: The world's largest electric ferry is being built in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: At 130 metres long, Hull 096 is the largest electric vehicle of its kind ever built, with the maker saying it represents a "giant leap forward in sustainable shipping".

title.children: Tasmanian-built world's largest electric ferry launches

image.altText: Mike Waltz wears a checked shirt and cold-weather jacket.

props.synopsis: The Trump adviser responsible for the Signal group chat that became a national security scandal is being replaced and nominated as the next US ambassador at the United Nations.

title.children: Trump ousts 'Signalgate' national security adviser Mike Waltz

image.altText: Albanese stands in the middle of a group of children, he's looking to the side with palms pressed together in greeting

props.synopsis: As Albanese and Dutton crisscrossed the country aiming to win over voters, ABC photographers were there to capture the best images of the campaign.

title.children: As Australia prepares to vote, we look back on the best photos of a frantic election campaign

image.altText: A mural dedicated to the Australian women killed by domestic violence in 2024 and 2025

props.synopsis: Violence against women has stirred outrage among voters and politicians have promised to do something about it. Their policy proposals tell a different story, write Heidi Davoren and Mary Lloyd.

title.children: It's the 'national crisis' that neither party has been able to solve

image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing glasses and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly killed WA police officer Anthony Woods has had his murder charge downgraded to manslaughter.

title.children: Murder charge over Perth police officer's death downgraded

image.altText: Anna Kendrick and Blake Lively stand next to each other and look seriously at the camera, there is a red background

props.synopsis: Blake Lively and Anna Kendrick come back to their world of fashion, martinis and murder for the equally deranged and delightful sequel to 2018's hit A Simple Favor.

title.children: Another Simple Favor is just as deranged and delightful as the first film

image.altText: An aerial view of a crowd on the street

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of people across the globe have held May Day protests opposing US President Donald Trump's agenda.

title.children: Global May Day protests held against Trump tariffs, administration

image.altText: A player holding a ball preparing to throw. Two players go head to head on the side

props.synopsis: Star Adelaide Thunderbirds defender Shamera Sterling-Humphrey will miss the remainder of the national netball season as she prepares to welcome her first child, with South African Sanmarie Visser announced as her replacement.

title.children: Adelaide Thunderbirds star 'so excited' to be welcoming first child

image.altText: An Amazon package sits on a doorstep.

props.synopsis: US stocks continue to reclaim ground from their post-tariff losses, with the S&P 500 gaining for an eighth straight session to reach its highest level since April 2. Amazon's shares fell in extended trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Amazon disappoints Wall St amid tariff uncertainty

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: How Apple is avoiding China tariffs
RBA could cut rates off the back of softer consumer spending

image.altText: A woman in an electric wheelchair named Eleanor Beidatsch pictured outside a polling place.

props.synopsis: Eleanor Beidatsch details the challenges she faces while voting in a wheelchair, while people with "invisible disabilities" can face even bigger hurdles.

title.children: For those of us with disabilities, voting can be an overwhelming experience

image.altText: Shells from dredging near Port Arthur

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An incident at sea, a shell-based discovery and a voting refresher course

image.altText: Unidentified woman in forground with left hand holding black and white holding ultrasound of baby scan

props.synopsis: A child born to an overseas commercial surrogate is in legal limbo, with experts estimating hundreds of other Australian children are also living with uncertain parentage.

title.children: Children left in legal limbo amid Australia's complex surrogacy laws

image.altText: A map highlights locations in the north Pacific Ocean, near Hawai'i

props.synopsis: Scientists and legal experts warn against commercial deep-sea mining as US President Donald Trump signs an executive order opening up both US and international waters.

title.children: 'Inherently destructive': Trump's deep-sea mining order sparks backlash

image.altText: Lawyer Joseph Acquaro outside the court.

props.synopsis: Authorities have abandoned the prosecution of the man accused of murdering Melbourne gangland lawyer Joseph “Pino” Acquaro, who was shot dead outside his gelato shop in 2016.

title.children: Charges dropped over gangland lawyer's murder

image.altText: Sarah Snook, a 37-year-old red-haired woman, smiles brightly in front of a poster of herself in character as Dorian Gray.

props.synopsis: Plus, Robert De Niro comes out in support of his daughter, Kendrick Lamar is heading to Ballarat, and quiz show Talkin' 'Bout Your Generation to return.

title.children: Sarah Snook and The Picture of Dorian Gray cop 6 Tony nominations
